intro: Buchozia, commonly known as the "tree of life," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in regions with tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, often fragrant flowers. Some species of Buchozia are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
